choices.D: Connect through Snowflake’s JDBC or ODBC drivers.
choices.C: Contact Snowflake Support for a new driver.

questions.question_text: What does Snowflake recommend a user do if they need to connect to Snowflake with a tool or technology that is not listed in Snowflake’s partner ecosystem?

choices.D: The same length of time as the expiration period for the query results cache
choices.C: The length of time specified in the expiration_time argument

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Its says FILE URL. Only the Scope and Presigned will expire.

Selected Answer: C
If we can agree that Cloud Storage means External Stages, then, based on the https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/unstructured-intro, the answer is C:
 
"Generates the pre-signed URL to a staged file using the stage name and relative file path as inputs. Access files in an external stage using the function." And this is for Pre-signed URL. Hence, answer is C

True or False: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) in Snowflake is only supported in conjunction with Single Sign-On (SSO).

discussion.content:
MFA token caching can be combined with connection caching in federated single sign-on.
To combine these two features, ensure that the ALLOW_ID_TOKEN parameter is set to true in tandem with the ALLOW_CLIENT_MFA_CACHING parameter

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
